wikipedia_page.main: David Norman Currie (born 27 November 1962) is an English former footballer who played as a striker for Middlesbrough, Darlington, Barnsley, Nottingham Forest, Oldham Athletic, Rotherham United, Huddersfield Town, Carlisle United and Scarborough.He joined Barnsley in 1988 and played 80 league games for them, scoring 30 goals. Currie joined Nottingham Forest in January 1990, and made his debut for them on 3 February, although in August 1990 he moved again to join Oldham.

response: * David Currie (broadcaster), BBC Scotland sports broadcaster
* David Currie (footballer) (born 1962), former Middlesbrough FC player
* David Currie, Baron Currie of Marylebone (born 1946), British economist, member of the House of Lords

23 August 1990 – Oldham Athletic pay a club record £460,000 for Nottingham Forest striker David Currie. Leeds United are warned that they face expulsion from the Football League if measures aimed by the Football Association at curbing incidents of hooliganism involving the club's fans fail.The Times and The Sunday Times Archive.
